metadata.title: CVE-2022-48938 linux
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:  CDC-NCM: avoid overflow in sanity checking  A broken device may give an extreme offset like 0xFFF0 and a reasonable length for a fragment. In the sanity check as formulated now, this will create an integer overflow, defeating the sanity check. Both offset and offset + len need to be checked in such a manner that no overflow can occur. And those quantities should be unsigned.
